Software Engineering Project - Course Guide

Planning

This page outlines the semester timeline, project weeks, milestones, and coaching cadence.

On this page

  • Semester timeline (S5)
  • Key milestones and deadlines
  • Week‑by‑week schedule
    • Focus
    • Coaching
      • Project coaching
      • Technical coaching

Semester timeline (S5)

DatesPeriodDescription
15/09–25/10Classes (modules)Regular classes
27/10–01/11Autumn breakNo classes
03/11–08/11Class/buffer weekBuffer / extra classes
10/11–22/11Module exam periodModule exams
24/11–20/12SE Project + BAP (part 1)Project weeks
22/12–03/01Winter/work breakNo on‑campus activities
05/01–17/01SE Project + BAP (part 2)Project weeks
19/01–24/01Exam windowProject oral exams + BAP evaluation

Notes

  • BAP input sessions may occur during class weeks and/or project weeks.
  • Working on campus: 24/11–17/01 (rooms announced at kick‑off).

Key milestones and deadlines

Date/RangeMilestoneDetailsLinks
Week of 15/09Course introductionSE Project and BAP overview. Project catalog is presented; forms will open soon.Projects · Team & topic selection
15/09–24/10Form teams (3 students)Self‑select teams and choose a team name. If you cannot form a team, contact coach before the deadline.Team & topic selection
By 24/10, 23:59Submit formsOne submission per team: team info + top 5 ranked project choices with short motivation.Team form · Project preferences form
25/10–27/10Allocation processingCoach assigns projects based on preferences, balance, and capacity; duplicates possible.—
27/10Allocations publishedOfficial mapping of teams to projects. No reallocation after publication—choose wisely.Announcements
24/11Kick‑offRecap + start project—
Week of 08/12Interim presentationsBAP/thesis‑style try‑out presentation (non‑technical).—
05/01Wrap‑up briefingExam instructions—
11/01 23:59BAP submissionFinal BAP report deadline—
19/01–24/01Oral examsProject defense + BAP evaluation—

See also: Deliverables & deadlines, Coaching, Weekly schedule & campus operations.

Week‑by‑week schedule

Focus

WeekDatesFocusKey outcomes
124/11–29/11Discovery & planningShared problem understanding, clear scope and assumptions, initial technical choices recorded, repository and ways‑of‑working set.
201/12–06/12MVP foundationsWalking skeleton in place, basic tests and CI running, initial user/developer docs outlined.
308/12–13/12Interim presentation & iterationNon‑technical BAP/thesis‑style presentation delivered; continue building, address feedback, improve quality and documentation.
415/12–20/12Feature growth & hardeningFunctionality expanded, stability improved, documentation kept current, risks captured and plan for the break defined.
—22/12–28/12Independent work period (part 1)Remote progress only; no on‑campus activities and no coaching during this period.
—29/12–03/01Independent work period (part 2)Remote progress only; no on‑campus activities and no coaching during this period.
505/01–10/01Finalization sprintMain scope complete, acceptance criteria validated, documentation finalized, release candidate prepared.
612/01–17/01Stabilization & exam prepPolishing and critical fixes; demo and oral defense rehearsed; thesis deliverables already submitted.
Exam19/01–24/01Project and BAP evaluationGroup oral technical defense and thesis (BAP) evaluation.

Cross‑references: Project selection and teams, Projects catalog
